We stayed in premier room with lounge access. Okay so here is my honest review. Room design: - Looks a bit boring, old fashioned. - Too dark. - Too many unimportant stuffs such as non-functioning cabinet drawer. - The toilet seat was a bit small. - Spacious room, minimum features. - No mirror except inside the bathroom. Cleanliness: - So many stains on rug, don't know when was the last time they washed it. Maybe because pandemic? - Sheets are clean - Some scratches on lousy wallpaper - Bathroom is clean. - No sanitary plastics - some visible wall stains - Window was really dirty - One of bed lamp was broken. Service: - Good standard and hospitality - Attentive i guess - Engineer was a bit quick to solve the bed lamp problem. Amenities: - For a four star hotel, overall is a bit.. minimum. - Internet was quite slow - Internet tv was not bad tho - less bathroom amenities - free soft drinks and peanut - two mineral bottles - afternoon tea but got no tea. maybe i should make one myself? Got 2 little burgers, 1 short cake, and 1 bitterballen for two pax, some fruit.... pineapples Breakfast: - we ordered american breakfast (in bed) and it came out like my 90 years old grandma made the breakfast. HORRIBLE for four star hotel. It doesn't need to be lavish, just proper is enough. - incomplete utensils - no salt n pepper for omelette - we got 2 pieces of little sausages each plate, 1 tasteless omelette, baked tomato, some baked potatoes, a toast without any condiments, pineapples (again), and mango juice maybe sunquick or such. - disappointing overall. another pandemic excuse? extra: i understand about PPKM so i did not expect any buffet or dine-in. But i believe food, especially breakfast is one of the keys that can turn guest's mood and evaluation. If you guys can sort out new ideas regarding breakfast-in-bed issue sooner it would be better. If i knew i'd get that kind of breakfast, i'd rather ordered non breakfast room and went for some online delivery services. How about you if you got that kind of Breakfast?
